intro: Pentapogon, commonly known as the five-lobed heath, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in the Cape Floristic Region. The plants are typically small shrubs with evergreen leaves and produce small, clustered flowers. They are adapted to nutrient-poor soils and are often found in fynbos vegetation. The genus includes several species, each with distinct floral and morphological characteristics.
